headline: Earnings season, CPI data, Fed commentary: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton goes over the top stories investors will be watching next week, starting Tuesday, July 15. Big Banks are kicking off a fresh earnings season: JPMorgan (JPM), Wells Fargo (WFC), and Citigroup (C) are reporting on Tuesday, while Bank of America (BAC), Morgan Stanley (MS), and Goldman Sachs (GS) are reporting on Wednesday. More earnings are expected on Thursday, with reports from Netflix (NFLX), Pepsico (PEP), and GE Aerospace (GE). June's Consumer Price Index (CPI) will be published, with economists expecting a mild uptick to 0.3% for both total and core CPI. A big batch of Federal Reserve commentary is expected on Tuesday and Thursday, from names like Fed Governor Michelle Bowman, Fed Governor Adriana Kugler, and more. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Bank earnings: Here's what investors & analysts are watching
summary: Bank earnings are on deck, with names like JPMorgan (JPM) in focus as markets look for signs of strength in the sector. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter David Hollerith and Freedom Capital Markets chief global strategist Jay Woods join Asking for a Trend with Josh Lipton to discuss what analysts and traders will be watching this quarter. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: Easing tariff fears are pushing S&P 500 targets higher
summary: Wall Street is getting more upbeat as tariff concerns ease and year-end targets for the S&P 500 (^GSPC) climb. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal breaks down the latest calls from Goldman Sachs (GS), Bank of America (BAC), and Wells Fargo (WFC), and explains what's driving the upward revisions. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
